intro: Veyretia neuroptera var. camposnovensis, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces violet-colored berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit makes it a popular subject in botanical studies and horticulture.
